div.span:
Thank you for coming to the BR website to see the amazing things that are happening at our school! For over 20 years we have been proud to offer our college preparatory program to West Michigan ...
Read More

span.strong: In-person classes/activities canceled for the remainder of the school year.
Welcome to Black River Public School
Main Office Hours temporarily suspended, normal M-F 7:30am-4:00pm

div.a: Community Service Requirement Update

span.p: A lot of questions have been coming to the school about community service hours. It is understandable that this is on our students' minds!

While we want to encourage students to continue to do positive things for our community, community service hours will not hold a student back from graduating this spring or from moving up in grade levels for next year. You will get more specific information regarding how to count community service hours for future years as well as suggestions for supporting our community from Mr. Donnelly very soon.

div.a: Course Registration for 2020-2021

span.p: Course registration for next year began before our unexpected closure. The deadline to register for classes is now April 17. The main offices will remain closed during the closure. However, families are welcome and encouraged to return forms by mail to:

Black River Public School
Attn: Jennifer Wise
491 Columbia Ave.
Holland, MI 49423
Forms can also be faxed to 355-0057 or scanned and emailed to wisej@brpsk12.org.(PDF copies rather than images are preferred for printing purposes)

a.title: Click to read more about: Course Registration for 2020-2021

div.a: Read More about Course Registration for 2020-2021
Technology Update - April 15, 2020

p.b: Could your student use a Chromebook during these new, remote learning times? Black River would love to help. Our technology team is busy preparing Chromebooks to be loaned out to families for the duration of this semester.
Please complete this request form and as always, if you have any technical questions you can reach out to our tech team at support@brpsk12.org.

div.a: Elementary Read Aloud with Upper Elementary Teacher, Ms. Carly

span.p: Join Ms. Carly as she reads What do you do with a problem? Written byKobi Yamada and illustrated byMae Besom.

div.a: We've Shared a Google Doc with the Staff and Teachers Office Hours

span.p: We have shared a Google documentthat has two tabs (Middle/High School and Elementary) with updated Staff and Teachers Remote Learning Office Hours to keep our parents/guardians informed. This document will be placed on the District Home page under > Resources > BRPS Staff and Teachers Office Hours and will be updated as needed for the remainder of the school year.

div.a: A Message from Shannon Brunink, Head of School - April 10, 2020

span.p: Black River Families,
We hope this Friday update finds our families looking forward to the upcoming weeks as we dive in to new challenges and learning experiences together. As we prepare, we ask that you:
Read this letterfrom Shannon Brunink, Head of School
View this Google slide presentationregarding remote learning at Black River Public School for the remainder of the 2020 school year.
Watch this video presentation by Shannon Brunink, Head of School
We are BR!

div.a: A Message from the Social Work/Counseling Team - April 10, 2020

span.p: The Social Work/Counseling team would like you to read this letter onways they will be able to provide support to our Black River families as we transition to remote learning. They have also compiled a folder with important ways for Coping with COVID-19.

div.a: A Message from the Tech Team Regarding Internet Services - April 9, 2020

span.p: As we move in to remote learning at Black River Public School, the tech team has put together a list of Internet providers offering free and accessible internet resources for students affected by COVID-19.We hope this is a valuable resource as our families practice safe social distancing and partner with us tocreate remote learning opportunitiesfor ourstudents. The tech team ishappy to answer any questions you have as we make this transition. Please email Caleb Fisher, Tech Director, at fisherc@brpsk12.org.

p.a: High Speed Internet Guide and Resources

div.a: A Message for Elementary Families from Mr. Jim - April 8, 2020

span.p: Hello BR Elementary MontessoriFamilies!Please see this message from Mr. Jim regarding the elementary transition to remote learning. Details for our MS/HS families will be released soon.

div.a: Elementary Read Aloud with Mr. Donnelly, Dean of Students

span.p: Join Mr. Donnelly reading, 'The Dinky Donkey'written byCraig Smithand illustrated by Katz Cowley.

div.a: Elementary Read Aloud with Kindergarten Assistant, Ms. Melissa

span.p: Join Ms. Melissa, Kindergarten Assistant, while she reads the story, How I Became a Pirate, by Melinda Long, illustrated by David Shannon.

img.alt: How I Became a Pirate Book Cover

div.a: A Message From the BRPS Social Work Team

span.p: COVID-19 has introduced a level of stress and uncertainty to our daily lives that leads to more anxiety, for parents and for kids. Since we know that the best way to help worried children is for parents to cope with their own anxiety in a healthy way. This week on childmind.org we are sharing skills for dialing down anxiety that will benefit both and make the whole family more comfortable.

div.a: All School Events Cancelled

span.p: Dear Students and Families of Black River,

As we all need to do our part to uphold the "Stay Home, Stay Safe" executive order, all school events are officially cancelled as previously scheduled through the rest of this 2019-2020 school year. While I'm sure everyone understands the situation, it does not make it any easier on our students.

Because we want to give our best care and support to our students, we are working to consider alternative ways to do some of the things that make BR so special every spring. Please keep checking the school web site for communications regarding non-traditional ways that we will continue to deliver the Black River Difference.
We are BR!

div.a: Infinite Campus Email Notification Tutorial

span.p: Black River Parents and Guardians - If you have access to Infinite Campus and are still not receiving email notifications, please watch thisshort video tutorial created by Mr. Jim on how to update your contact preferences. If you do not have Infinite Campus access or have forgotten your password, contact Kelli Heneghanat heneghank@brpsk12.org.

div.a: A Letter from Shannon Brunink, Head of School - April 2, 2020

span.p: Please take a moment to read thisletter from Shannon Brunink, Head of School regarding Governor Whitmer's announcement today, Thursday, April 2, 2020.

div.a: AP Exam Information & Updates from College Board

span.p: Black River parents and students scheduled to take the upcoming APexams- Please click on the linkbelow from College Board regarding updates to this years AP exams:

div.a: Helpful Online Resources for Keeping BRPS Students Engaged

span.p: Making sure our parents and community members have access to free, digital platforms is one way to help keep our students engaged and learning during this difficult time. Below are sites that have been shared by teachers and parents to helpfillour days with meaningful activities. Please contact Kelli Heneghan at heneghank@brpsk12.org if you have a site to add to our growing list.

p.a: Online Resources for BRPS Parents and Caregivers

div.a: Elementary Read Aloud with Mr. Adam

span.p: When her parents go out for the evening, a little girl threatens to run off to the South Pole, but has a good time with the babysitter instead.Mr Adam reads the story, Dont Forget to Come Back, by Robie H. Harris, illustrated by Harry Bliss.

div.a: Self-Care is Important During the School Closure
Elementary Read Aloud with Ms. Kendra

span.p: What makes bats so interesting and useful? Find out with our Lower Elementary Montessori Teacher, Ms. Kendra, as she reads Bat Love the Night by Nicola Davies, illustrated by Sarah Fox-Davies.

div.a: Elementary Read Aloud with Ms. Beth

span.p: Happy, Sunny FridayBR Families! Watch upper elementary teacher, Ms. Beth read the story, How to Find a Fox, by Nilah Magruder.

div.a: Elementary Read Aloud with Ms. Robin

span.p: Today Ms. Robin is reading Try a Little Kindness by Henry Cole. Ms. Robin chose this book because we are spending a lot of time with our family right now and we can use this helpful reminder of things we can do to make it easier.

div.a: Elementary Read Aloud with Ms. Jamie

span.p: Ms. Jamie reads the story Pig the Tourist by Aaron Blabey.Enjoy!

div.a: A Message from Shannon Brunink, Head of School - March 31, 2020

span.p: Dear BR Community,

Some media sources have reported details they expect to come from Governor Whitmer regardingwhat schools will need to do for the rest of this school year. While we continue to plan for how to best serve our BR students, we will not be rolling out plans until the executive order is actually given from our governor. We do not want to give incorrect information based on anything other than the actual guidance from Governor Whitmer and the Michigan Department of Education.
Thank you all for your patience!

div.a: Mr. Schwartz Creates 3D Animation Video Short

span.p: Mr. Schwartz consolidated some of his3D Animation class videos from their"AbstractSoothing" unit into one video. Hethought wemight all enjoysome calming images and sounds in theseuncertaintimes.

div.a: A Message from Shannon Brunink, Head of School - March 30, 2020

span.p: Dear Families,
First off, we miss you all so much!

As we wait for the final word from Governor Whitmer about the specifics to come about school expectations, please know that a lot of information will be coming through email very soon from Black River and your child's teachers. Please be ready by making sure to check that your Infinite Campus contactinformation is up to date so you do not miss communications about our plans for continuing the school year.
Don't forget that Infinite Campus has an easy app to update preferences! Below is the link to app information:
If you cannot access your Infinite Campus account please contact Kelli Heneghan at heneghank@brpsk12.org.

div.a: BRPS Playground Closed

span.p: Due to the COVID 19 school campus closure, we ask thatcommunity membersrefrain from congregating/using our playgrounds or outdoor facilities, as these are not being sanitized. We have been contacted by our local authorities and they are doing their best to monitor these locations, but we really could use your assistance in making sure we all are following the best practices for community health.

div.a: Read 'The Current' for Students News and More During the School Closure

span.p: Looking to engage with your peers? Students and teachers alike are publishing fun and entertaining news for The Current, our student news website, which you can find atbrpscurrent.com.

New student polls are published each week, and commenting is open so that students can respond to each other's publications. This week's feature: Ms. Stephens' cat makes some observations about the new world order.
Students can also submit their own work for publicationhere. Don't miss out!

div.a: Stronger together, From wherever!

span.p: No matter the changes we face in the days and months ahead - nothing is more important to us than the health and safety of our community. We miss you all and want you to know that we are here for you. Continue to take care of yourself - We are BR!

div.a: OAISD COVID-19 Response Interactive Lookup Map

span.p: Enter your address on the OAISD address lookup mapto find a Food Distribution near you.

div.a: Academic News - 2019 Fall Honor Roll and Dean's List Recipients

p.font: Black Riverbelieves in recognizing students who achieve academically during each semester grading period. There are two ways students will be recognized each term.First, students maintaining a GPA between 3.0 and 3.49 can make the Honor Roll. Students can also be recognized by making the Dean's List andhave earned a GPA higher than 3.5. Wewish these studentscontinued successand congratulate themon all that theyhave achieved.

font.a: 2019 Fall Semester Middle School Honor Roll

br.a: 2019 Fall Semester Middle School Dean's List

font.a: 2019 Fall Semester High School Honor Roll

br.a: 2019 Fall Semester High School Dean's List

p.font: Students who wish to have a copy of their honor certificate should watch for the sign-up sheet out side of Mr. Donnelly's office once we are back in session.

div.a: Free Meals Offered to All Ottawa Area Families

span.p: OTTAWA COUNTY, MI -K-12 school districts throughout the Ottawa area are working to ensure that all students throughout the OAISD service region are included in meal distribution plans during the school closure period amid the COVID-19 emergency. Below is information to be shared with families:

ul.li: Parents may participate in ANY of our local district food service plans now through April 5, 2020. Refer to the links below for specific information for each district. Most are offering multiple pick up opportunities to receive meals for multiple days to limit the number of trips required.
Though some local district sites refer to all children age 18 & under, they realize thatSpecial Needsincludes students up to age 26 and are prepared to serve these families.
There is NO cost for the meals, regardless of whether or not the family qualifies for the Free/Reduced Lunch Program.Children do NOT need to be present with the parent(s) to pick up meals.
For planning purposes, some districts are requesting advance information. Please encourage parents to visit the district links below as soon as possible to assist in these efforts.

p.strong: BLACK RIVER FAMILIES SHOULD UTILIZE THE CLOSEST SCHOOL DISTRICT

div.a: A Message Regarding Cancelled Event Donations & Payments

p.i: Since many things have been cancelled, we are working on refunding people who may have paid for an activity that did not take place or return donations for events that were cancelled. Please be patient as we work through multipleplatforms that were used for these payments and donations.More information coming soon!

div.a: A Message from Shannon Brunink, Head of School - March 16, 2020

span.p: Dear Black River Community,

We havebeen looking into possibilities for us to provide meals for children in the area during this time of school closure. In doing so, it has been apparent that since our food service is outsourced out of Caledonia, it would be much more efficient for us to promote the offerings and serve more kids through the offerings Holland Public Schools is making available to all areachildren. Here is the information from their website:

a.title: Click to read more about: A Message from Shannon Brunink, Head of School - March 16, 2020

div.a: Read More about A Message from Shannon Brunink, Head of School - March 16, 2020
City of Holland Summer Junior Police Academy Dates Announced

span.p: Each summer the Holland Police Departmenthosts a Junior Police Academy for 7th and 8th graders (for students who have just completed the 6th or 7th grade). There will be one academy which will run for three weeks. Class sessions will be Monday through Thursday from 8 a.m. to 1 p.m. A mid-morning snack will be provided, and field-trip transportation will be by Max Bus. BR parents can contact Officer Nicole Hamberg atn.hamberg@cityofholland.comwith questions.
Check the link for more information:

span.p: We are excited to announce our 2020 Black River Summer Camp dates!

2020 Black River Summer Camp Registration Form

div.a: Enrollment for the 2020-2021 Academic Year

span.b: 2020-2021 Black River Public School Open Enrollment for grades K-12

span.p: Open Enrollment ended on February 26, 2020. All applications received by February 26 at 4pm will be included in the enrollment lottery.

Families are still encouraged to apply using the post lottery application. All applications received post lottery will be added to the wait list for the applicable grade level. If an opening occurs, families will be contacted.

For more information regarding open enrollment and our lottery please visit our admissions page. Any questions regarding admissions or enrollment, please contact our Enrollment Coordinator, Nicole Klunder, at klundern@brpsk12.org or 355-0055, ext. 116.

div.a: OK2Say Hotline is Always Open

span.p: Stop the Silence!Black River Parents and Guardians - If you are worried about a student, don't be afraid to speak up by contacting the Ok2Say Hotline to leave an anonymous tip - OPEN 24/7 including weekends and before/during school hours.Specially trained technicians receive the tips and filter the information to the appropriate agency.Please use this resourceif you have a concern during a time school is not in session. Contacting 911 with a concern is also an option. These methods will be thequickest way to ensure student safety.Thank you!
Phone: 855-565-2729 Text: 652729 (OK2SAY) Email:ok2say@mi.gov

div.a: GVSU Charter School Office College Prep Week 2020

span.p: GVSU College Prep Weeks for Summer 2020 have been announced. Theapplication linkisavailable through Friday, May 1, 2020.

div.a: Fundraiser for 'Suessical The Musical' Fundraiser, Wednesday, May 13

span.p: The spring Black River Theatre Company fundraiser for 'Seussical the Musical' is May 13, 2020. Please stop by Panera in Hollandany time (yes, ALL DAY!)on Wednesday, May 13and mention the BRTC fundraiser and they receive 20% of whatever is purchased.

div.a: Order your 2019-2020 School Yearbook Here!

span.p: It's time to start thinking about ordering this year's yearbook. We are working with a new company this year. Jostens offers a $5.00 incentive if you order your yearbook early. The Elementary Yearbook is $20.00 when ordering early, and the High School Yearbook is $45.00 when ordered early.
Below you will find the links to follow to order each yearbook. Please make sure that you click on the correct link for the yearbook you are ordering.
Elementary Yearbook $20.00 If ordered before October 11, 2019
High School Yearbook $45.00 if ordered before October 11, 2019
If you have any questions, contact Joy Shirk, the yearbook adviser atshirkj@brpsk12.org
